SENT.plain: Although the most common aetiology of transient vertebrobasilar insufficiency is atherosclerosis, a similar syndrome may occasionally be produced by cervical osteophytes
The possibility of such a remedial lesion makes further investigation mandatory in such patients-especially if symptoms are associated with sudden movements of the head or neck
When vertebral compression results from osteophytes, it can be easily relieved by a minor modification of the usual anterior cervical fusion technique
This method has proved to be quite efficacious in two patients whose case histories are reported
